If you prefer fewer crowds and cooler temperatures, early autumn (September to mid-October) is a great time to travel — especially if you’re interested in wine regions or fall colors. If you’re planning a route that includes high mountain passes, avoid winter altogether. Many of the famous alpine roads close between late October and May due to snow, and even in early spring or late autumn, they can be temporarily closed after a storm. If you're not sure whether a route is open, you can find up-to-date information online through the Alpenpässe website . (Photo: Switzerland Tourism Matthias Nutt) Autumn is a great season for a Swiss road trip (Photo: Switzerland Tourism Matthias Nutt) Renting a car in Switzerland Renting a car in Switzerland is straightforward , especially if you're coming from another European country. Most rental companies require you to be at least 20 or 21 years old and you’ll need a valid driver’s license and a credit card.
